description: Microsoft 365 Government Community Cloud High - designed for federal agencies and contractors handling CUI

control_mappings.microsoft_responsibility: Microsoft manages the M365 platform access control mechanisms, including Azure AD authentication and authorization services
control_mappings.customer_responsibility: Customer configures user access policies, assigns roles, and manages user provisioning/deprovisioning within their tenant
control_mappings.implementation_guidance: Configure Conditional Access policies, enable MFA, review user access regularly using Azure AD access reviews
evidence_artifacts: Azure AD Conditional Access policies configuration

control_mappings.microsoft_responsibility: Microsoft provides role-based access control (RBAC) capabilities within M365 services
control_mappings.customer_responsibility: Customer implements and enforces transaction controls by assigning appropriate roles and permissions
control_mappings.implementation_guidance: Use built-in M365 roles or create custom roles, implement least privilege principle

control_mappings.microsoft_responsibility: Microsoft provides external sharing controls and guest access management capabilities
control_mappings.customer_responsibility: Customer configures external sharing policies and manages guest user access
control_mappings.implementation_guidance: Configure SharePoint and Teams external sharing settings, review guest users regularly

control_mappings.customer_responsibility: Customer implements separation of duties through role assignments and approval workflows
control_mappings.implementation_guidance: Design role structure to separate duties, implement approval workflows in Power Automate

control_mappings.microsoft_responsibility: Microsoft secures M365 platform connections and provides API security
control_mappings.customer_responsibility: Customer manages application registrations and API permissions
control_mappings.implementation_guidance: Review app registrations, implement least privilege for API permissions, monitor OAuth consent grants

control_mappings.microsoft_responsibility: Microsoft generates and stores audit logs for M365 services
control_mappings.customer_responsibility: Customer enables audit logging, reviews logs, and retains per policy requirements
control_mappings.implementation_guidance: Enable Microsoft 365 audit logging, configure retention policies, export logs to SIEM if required

control_mappings.microsoft_responsibility: Microsoft captures user actions in audit logs with user identity
control_mappings.customer_responsibility: Customer reviews audit logs for user accountability and investigates anomalies
control_mappings.implementation_guidance: Regularly review user activity reports, investigate unusual access patterns

control_mappings.customer_responsibility: Customer reviews and analyzes audit logs to detect security incidents
control_mappings.implementation_guidance: Establish audit review procedures, use Microsoft Defender for Cloud Apps or SIEM for analysis

control_mappings.microsoft_responsibility: Microsoft provides Azure AD for user identity management
control_mappings.customer_responsibility: Customer manages user identities, ensures uniqueness, and provisions/deprovisions users
control_mappings.implementation_guidance: Use Azure AD as identity provider, implement automated provisioning, maintain user directory

control_mappings.microsoft_responsibility: Microsoft provides authentication mechanisms including MFA through Azure AD
control_mappings.customer_responsibility: Customer enforces authentication policies and requires MFA for users
control_mappings.implementation_guidance: Enable MFA for all users, configure authentication policies, monitor authentication failures

control_mappings.microsoft_responsibility: Microsoft provides MFA capabilities through Azure AD MFA
control_mappings.customer_responsibility: Customer enforces MFA requirements for all remote and privileged access
control_mappings.implementation_guidance: Require MFA via Conditional Access policies, support multiple MFA methods, monitor MFA usage

control_mappings.microsoft_responsibility: Microsoft uses FIPS 140-2 validated cryptographic modules for authentication in M365 GCC High
control_mappings.implementation_guidance: No customer action required - inherent in M365 GCC High platform

control_mappings.microsoft_responsibility: Microsoft implements replay-resistant authentication mechanisms in Azure AD
control_mappings.implementation_guidance: No customer action required - inherent in Azure AD authentication
evidence_artifacts: Microsoft security documentation on replay protection

control_mappings.microsoft_responsibility: Microsoft implements boundary protection for M365 infrastructure
control_mappings.customer_responsibility: Customer configures network boundaries for on-premises connections (if hybrid)
control_mappings.implementation_guidance: If hybrid, implement Azure AD Connect securely, use VPN for ExpressRoute

control_mappings.microsoft_responsibility: Microsoft enforces TLS 1.2+ for all M365 service communications
control_mappings.implementation_guidance: No customer action required - TLS enforced by platform

control_mappings.microsoft_responsibility: Microsoft implements encryption for data at rest and in transit in M365 GCC High using FIPS 140-2 validated modules
control_mappings.implementation_guidance: No customer action required - encryption enforced by platform

control_mappings.microsoft_responsibility: Microsoft encrypts all data at rest in M365 GCC High using BitLocker and service encryption
control_mappings.implementation_guidance: No customer action required - encryption automatic. Optional: Use Customer Key for additional control

control_mappings.microsoft_responsibility: Microsoft identifies, reports, and corrects system flaws in M365 platform
control_mappings.implementation_guidance: No customer action required - Microsoft patches platform. Customer should monitor Microsoft 365 Message Center

control_mappings.microsoft_responsibility: Microsoft provides Microsoft Defender for Office 365 with anti-malware capabilities
control_mappings.customer_responsibility: Customer enables and configures Defender for Office 365 policies
control_mappings.implementation_guidance: Enable Safe Attachments and Safe Links, configure anti-malware policies, review threat reports

control_mappings.microsoft_responsibility: Microsoft automatically updates malicious code protection mechanisms in Defender for Office 365
control_mappings.implementation_guidance: No customer action required - updates automatic

control_mappings.microsoft_responsibility: Microsoft monitors M365 infrastructure and provides security monitoring tools
control_mappings.customer_responsibility: Customer uses Microsoft Defender for Cloud Apps and audit logs to monitor tenant activity
control_mappings.implementation_guidance: Enable Defender for Cloud Apps, configure alerts, review security reports regularly

notes: M365 GCC High provides significant inherited controls especially for cryptography, transmission security, and platform-level protections. Shared responsibility model requires customer configuration of identity, access, and monitoring controls.
